paragraphs.text: Linda Elizabeth Reichl (born 1942)[1] is a statistical physicist who works in the Center for Complex Quantum Systems at the University of Texas at Austin,[2] and is known for her research on quantum chaos.[3]

paragraphs.title: Education
paragraphs.text: Reichl completed her Ph.D. in 1969 at the University of Denver with the dissertation Microscopic Theory of Quasiparticle Spin Fluctations in a Fermi Liquid.[4] She was advised by Elizabeth R. Tuttle and Ilya Prigogine.[5]

paragraphs.title: Books
paragraphs.text:
Reichl's books include:

She is also the co-editor of several volumes of collected papers.

paragraphs.title: Recognition
paragraphs.text: Reichl became a Fellow of the American Physical Society in 2000 "for her original contributions to the field of quantum chaos".[3]
